intro: Tritonixia deusta, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. Tritonixia deusta is often found growing along rocky outcrops and in sandy soils. Its ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes it an important plant in ecological restoration projects.
